required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020

clinical_study.brief_title: Delayed Cord Clamping With Oxygen In Extremely Low Gestation Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Delayed Cord Clamping With Oxygen In Extremely Low Gestation Infants

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)
Sharp Mary Birch Hospital for Women & Newborns

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to determine whether provision of a higher level of supplemental oxygen with CPAP/PPV during delayed cord clamping improves peripheral oxygen saturation in infants born at 23+0 to 27+6 gestational age compared to a lower level of supplemental oxygen.

detailed_description.textblock:
Prenatal consent will be obtained on infant's with estimated gestational age of 23+0 to 27+6. Shortly before delivery, infant's will be randomly assigned to receive either Low oxygen concentration (FiO2 .30) OR High oxygen concentration (FiO2 1.0) during 60 seconds of delayed cord clamping.
Randomization and intervention will remain blinded to the clinical care team during the entire study period. The research team member will open a randomization card when notified of a subject's impending birth, review the protocol with the obstetric provider performing the procedure, set-up the sterile special bed, and note the time it takes from delivery until the clamping and cutting of the umbilical cord in both groups.
The research team member will set the oxygen blender as indicated by the randomization card and cover the blender to blind the FiO2 setting. The research team member will not be involved in the clinical care of the infant. The oxygen blender will be concealed from the clinical care team to ensure resuscitation maneuvers will not be biased.
Data will be submitted to the statistician, who will remain blinded to the intervention for the duration of the study.
If an infant is randomized to the DCC and Low Oxygen concentration (DCC LO group), the following procedure will ensue:
At delivery, the infant will be placed on a special bed that allows the infant to be close to the mother, adequate to keep the umbilical cord intact. These beds are equipped with an oxygen blender, humidifier, t-piece resuscitator with mask, necessary to provide CPAP/PPV. During delayed cord clamping, breathing assistance with CPAP of 5 cm H20 or positive pressure ventilation (starting PIP of 20 cm H20) and a FiO2 .30 oxygen. The infant's face will be dried and a non-sterile mask will be placed on the infant's face to deliver pressure to help open their lungs. The infant will remain on this support up until the umbilical cord is clamped. Once the cord is clamped, resuscitation will continue according to unit protocol.
If an infant is randomized to the DCC and High Oxygen concentration (DCC HI group), the following procedure will ensue:
At delivery, the infant will be placed on a special bed that allows the infant to be close to the mother, adequate to keep the umbilical cord intact. These beds are equipped with an oxygen blender, humidifier, t-piece resuscitator with mask, necessary to provide CPAP/PPV. During delayed cord clamping, breathing assistance with CPAP of 5 cm H20 or positive pressure ventilation (starting PIP of 20 cm H20) and a FiO2 1.0 oxygen. The infant's face will be dried and a non-sterile mask will be placed on the infant's face to deliver pressure to help open their lungs. The infant will remain on this support up until the umbilical cord is clamped. Once the cord is clamped, resuscitation will continue according to unit protocol.
Patency of the airway will be assessed by a Colorimetric CO2 detector. Lack of color change will indicate that the airway is not patent (obstructed), the pressure is not sufficient to expand the lungs, there was excessive air leak, or there was no or inadequate pulmonary blood flow. If there is no color change, the neonatal provider will reposition and reattempt to open the airway with CPAP or PPV. PIP pressures can be increased if there is no change in color by the CO2 detector.
The Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS) will be applied once the infant is considered stable by the medical team. The NIRS sensor will be placed on the infant's forehead. Cerebral StO2, SpO2, blood pressure (once in the NICU) and Heart rate will be recorded every two seconds and linked with other variables. These variables will continue to be recorded for the first 24 hours of life.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Once consent is obtained and the research staff is notified of a subject's impending birth, our research team member will open a randomization card and set the oxygen blender on the special bed to either an FiO2 of .30 or 1.0 and cover the blender. The research team member will not be involved in the clinical care for the infant and will blind the clinical care team from the randomized assignment.

primary_outcome.measure: Peripheral arterial oxygen saturation at 5 minutes of life
primary_outcome.description: Peripheral arterial oxygen saturation at 5 minutes of life in infants 23-27 weeks receiving assisted breathing with CPAP/PPV and either an FiO2 of .30 or 1.0 during delayed cord clamping

secondary_outcome.measure: All Grade IVH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion at hospital discharge, up to 6 months corrected gestational age (CGA)
secondary_outcome.description: Any Intraventricular Hemorrhage (grades 1-4)

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Grade III and IV intraventricular hemorrhage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion at hospital discharge, up to 6 months corrected gestational age (CGA)
secondary_outcome.description: Intraventricular hemorrhages (grades 3-4) (bleeding in the brain parenchyma and/or ventricular dilation

secondary_outcome.measure: Resuscitation interventions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the first 10 minutes of life
secondary_outcome.description: Resuscitation interventions including positive pressure ventilation, continuous positive airway pressure, intubation, chest compressions, medications

secondary_outcome.measure: Assignment of correct FiO2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During delayed cord clamping up to 60 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Infant receiving FiO2 as assigned by randomization

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to demonstrate cycling of end tidal CO2 (seconds)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During delayed cord clamping up to 60 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Time to demonstrate cycling of end tidal CO2 (seconds)

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedure Failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During delayed cord clamping up to 60 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: (i.e. Inability to get infant on special bed (trolley), cord avulsion)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Cord Clamping
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During delayed cord clamping up to 60 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Time to cord clamping

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in heart rate (BPM) in the first 10 minutes of life

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in heart rate (BPM) in the first 10 minutes of life

secondary_outcome.description: Duration of positive pressure ventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Hypoxia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first 10 minutes of life in the delivery room
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of Hypoxia (defined as oxygen saturation <25th percentile of target ranges defined by Dawson et al.) in the first 10 minutes after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Hyperoxia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first 10 minutes of life in the delivery room
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of Hyperoxia (defined as oxygen saturation > 95%) in the first 10 minutes after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressures in the first 24 hours of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the first 24 hours of life
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressures every hour in the first 24 hours of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebral tissue oxygenation in the first 24 hours of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the first 24 hours of life
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral tissue oxygenation every hour in the first 24 hours of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Average oxygen saturation in the first 5 minutes after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 5 minutes of life
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation in the first 5 minutes after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Heart rate in the first 5 minutes after birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 5 minutes of life
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate in the first 5 minutes after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Intubation in the Delivery room or Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth through study completion at discharge, up to 6 months of corrected gestational age

secondary_outcome.measure: Early onset septicemia (</=72 hours from birth) (positive blood culture and at least 5 days of antibiotic therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion at discharge, up to 6 months of corrected gestational age
secondary_outcome.description: Early onset septicemia (</=72 hours from birth) (positive blood culture and at least 5 days of antibiotic therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion at discharge, up to 6 months of corrected gestational age
secondary_outcome.description: Late onset septicemia (>72 hours from birth) (positive blood culture and at least 5 days of antibiotic therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Spontaneous Intestinal Perforation (SIP) requiring surgery or peritoneal drain

secondary_outcome.description: Spontaneous Intestinal Perforation (SIP) requiring surgery or peritoneal drain

secondary_outcome.measure: Necrotizing Enterocolitis (Modified Bell's stage 2-3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion at discharge, up to 6 months of corrected gestational age
secondary_outcome.description: Necrotizing Enterocolitis (Modified Bell's stage 2-3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia (receiving continuous supplemental oxygen at 36 weeks corrected gestational age

other_outcome.description: Combined outcome of severe IVH and/or death

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion or death, up to 6 months of corrected gestational age

arm_group.description: During 60 seconds of delayed cord clamping and oxygen blender set at FiO2 .30, breathing assistance with CPAP of 5 cmH20 or positive pressure ventilation (starting PIP of 20 cmH20) is provided. The infant will remain on this support up until the umbilical cord is clamped. Once the cord is clamped, resuscitation will continue according to unit protocol.

During 60 seconds of delayed cord clamping and oxygen blender set at FiO2 1.0, breathing assistance with CPAP of 5 cmH20 or positive pressure ventilation (starting PIP of 20 cmH20) is provided. The infant will remain on this support up until the umbilical cord is clamped. Once the cord is clamped, resuscitation will continue according to unit protocol.

intervention.intervention_name: Delayed Cord Clamping with Low Oxygen concentration
intervention.description: During delayed umbilical cord clamping of 60 seconds, breathing assistance with CPAP/PPV and low oxygen concentration (FiO2 0.30) will be provided.

intervention.intervention_name: Delayed Cord Clamping with High Oxygen concentration
intervention.description: During delayed umbilical cord clamping of 60 seconds, breathing assistance with CPAP/PPV and high oxygen concentration (FiO2 1.0) will be provided.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 23+0 to 27+6 weeks Gestational age
- Single and Multiple pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parents decline consent
- Congenital anomalies of the newborn
- Placental abruption, accreta, percreta
- Monochorionic multiple pregnancy (i.e. Di/Mo or Mo/Mo twins)
- Prolonged premature rupture of membranes (>2 weeks) prior to 23 weeks gestation

facility.name: Sharp Mary Birch Hospital for Women and Newborns

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be made available per NICHD requirements (National Institute of Child Health and Human Development)
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: An archived dataset with documentation will be made available for additional users by outside investigators, in collaboration with the study investigators. We will work with NICHD program staff to develop a broad data sharing plan over time.
